definition[0]: something that is kept ready so that it can be used when needed
example[0]: Powdered milk is a good standby in an emergency.
definition[1]: a standby ticket is one that you can get only if places become available, for example if other people cannot use their tickets
definition[2]: someone or something that is ready to be used when needed
example[1]: The government has asked potential donor countries for 75,000 tonnes of grain as a standby.
definition[3]: when you are ready to travel on a plane, but can only do so if there are seats left when it is ready to leave
example[2]: The flight is full, but we can put you on standby.
definition[4]: a standby ticket is a cheap ticket for a plane journey that you buy just before the plane leaves
definition[5]: a standby arrangement or agreement allows a member state of the INTERNATIONAL MONETARY FUND to receive money if it has serious financial problems
example[3]: About $45 million was available in instalments under a standby arrangement.
example[4]: The International Monetary Fund has approved a new Â£596 million standby loan for Pakistan.
